address: Thị trấn Chư Prông, Huyện Chư Prông, Tỉnh Gia Lai
thought:
**Determining the New Ward for an Old Address**

Okay, so I've got an old address: "Thị trấn Chư Prông", "Tỉnh Gia Lai", and I need to figure out the corresponding new administrative unit. My process is pretty straightforward, but I'll make sure to double-check everything.

First, I identified the old ward and province: "Thị trấn Chư Prông" and "Tỉnh Gia Lai". Now, I'll start digging into the resolutions.

I checked Resolution 60-NQ/TW to see if anything happened to Gia Lai. Good news! It seems Gia Lai stayed Gia Lai, even though it absorbed Bình Định. This means I don't need to worry about the province name changing.

Next, I zeroed in on Resolution 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15. I needed to see if it mentioned "Thị trấn Chư Prông". Bingo! Line 47 was the key. It clearly states that "Thị trấn Chư Prông" and a few other areas are being reorganized into a new ward called "xã Chư Prông". Perfect!

To confirm this, I cross-referenced this information with the list of new wards. I looked for "xã Chư Prông" in "Tỉnh Gia Lai", and there it was: `{"ward_code":"23887","ward_name":"Xã Chư Prông","province_name":"Tỉnh Gia Lai"}`.

The resolution directly links the old and new wards, and the names match up perfectly. Plus, the province is consistent. This is a very high-confidence match. I'm feeling good about this! Now I just need to format the answer according to the specified JSON schema.

citation.header: 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Gia Lai
citation.line: 47. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của thị trấn Chư Prông và các xã Ia Phìn, Ia Kly, Ia Drang thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Chư Prông.
